intro: Aframomum leptolepis, commonly known as the slender edge nutmeg, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a spindle-shaped, three-lobed capsule that contains aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine. The botanical features of Aframomum leptolepis make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
